intro: Castilleja parviflora var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and exhibits a unique relationship with its host plants, deriving some of its nutrients through specialized root structures. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands, where it can receive adequate sunlight. Its flowers are small and usually pink to reddish in color, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Castilleja parviflora var. parviflora plays a role in local ecosystems by contributing to plant diversity and providing habitat for various insects.
